metadata.title: CVE-2022-45887 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 6.0.9.drivers/media/usb/ttusb-dec/ttusb_dec.c has a memory leak because of thelack of a dvb_frontend_detach call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-162-generic - 5.4.0-162.179~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-162-lowlatency - 5.4.0-162.179~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1109-aws - 5.4.0-1109.118~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1115-azure - 5.4.0-1115.122~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1112-gcp - 5.4.0-1112.121~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1056-ibm - 5.4.0-1056.61~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1108-oracle - 5.4.0-1108.117~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1093-raspi - 5.4.0-1093.104~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-162.179~18.04.1').
